#summary Introduction to sma2pvoutput.org

= About SMA2PVOutput.ps1 =

A [#Windows_PowerShell Windows Powershell] script that takes data from an [#SMA_Inverter SMA inverter] and uploads it to [#pvoutput.org pvoutput.org]

<wiki:toc max_depth="3" />

= Introduction =

The SMA2PVOutput.ps1 script is intended to be used in conjunction with the [#Sunny_Explorer Sunny Explorer] software from SMA to gather data from a solar PV plant and upload it to [#pvoutput.org pvoutput.org].

The script can be run on a scheduled basis to periodically post status updates that can then be viewed remotely via the [#pvoutput.org pvoutput.org] web site.

= Getting Started =

== pvoutput.org ==

http://www.pvoutput.org is a free service for sharing, comparing and monitoring live solar photovoltaic (PV) and energy consumption data. In order to upload data to a system, it is first necessary to register an account.

Once you have a user registered, log in and [#Adding_a_System add your system(s)] to the account.

For more information on pvoutput.org, see http://www.pvoutput.org/help.html

=== API Settings ===

Your [http://www.pvoutput.org/account.jsp account settings] page on pvoutput.org include a section titled API Settings. In order for the script to function you should ensure that the API Access setting within this section is set to Enabled.

Once API Access is Enabled, you need an API Key which can be generated from the [http://www.pvoutput.org/account.jsp account settings] page by clicking on the New Key button.
